content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty hey crafters damn Scotty here welcome to the
craft today I want to show you a piece that I'm doing for AJ's crypt and really
I really wanted to talk about was how you can take junk from your Vince box
which you should always start if you're a crafter you should just find kind of
cool odds and ends you can throw it in your bits box and then safe to make cool
stuff like this so what I really wanted to talk about was you know taking those
bits and just making something cool out of it so what I thought be neat for the
Crypt was an infernal type machine like an ancient machine and so I've cobbled
that together out of bits for my bits box something cool for his crypt I'm
actually winding down with that grip so we'll be actually sending that they EJ
pretty soon so all right let's go to the table I'll show you what i cobbled
together hey guys here's something I'm working on and this is going to be an
infernal machine so this is going to be an AJ's crypt and I'm going to talk
about the various parts I used to construct this also it's gonna be above
one of these old dice boxes so this is going to be it's gonna be sitting on
this I'm going to attach it to this so it'll be kind of neat and I'll show you
that later but right now I want to talk about how I did this this piece so what
I did was I for the base of this I used some wood zis and these you can get this
all these different shapes at the craft store and I've just glued this on and my
glue of choice for this kind of stuff is group this is a fantastic glue great
bond it is kind of viscous though and and sometimes I used toothpicks to apply
it because it's kind of tricky to apply straight out of this large spout but it
has a great bond so I use that to secure the base and then I had a old Halloween
or Halloween skeleton so I broke off the legs and then glued inside this base now
the skeleton itself had a skull head but you can see that this has like a mask on
it and this mask is actually from a predator that I piece that I got I went
to to a flea market and found junk and that's a great place you can find junk
toys to use for stuff so that's what this is this is just a predator mask and
the back piece here is like an armed guard so I thought that we really looked
neat on the back and I can see I also added some some wire coming out some
like tubing so I just put that in the base glued it in the base and then drill
a few holes in this wood Basin in the skull and then insert it so that gave a
nice effect I also used a few pits from pieces from my bits box here's a few
like dragon heads and like a chaos type thing so I put that on the chest I also
added some of the the some damage to it or some rust to it by adding the
flexible modelling paste just by kind of dabbing that on a bit and that gives us
some like corrosion or stuff like that I may not have rust cuz I'm gonna paint
this unusual color but it'll be some kind of corrosion or something on the
piece now you can see this just kind of looks like a real mishmash of stuff it
really doesn't look too fantastic at this stage but you know have faith on
this kind of stuff because once you paint this this is gonna look freaking
fantastic like I say it just looks like a hodgepodge right now but when we paint
it it's gonna look great because it will give it all a uniform color and
everything so let me go paint this and then I'll show you how it comes out hey
guys here's my finished infernal machine I leave you a better look at it pull it
up there see it came out really nice I used a metallic green a dark metallic
green on the machine itself and I also attached
the dice box to the bottom there and you can see I did some details I even put a
figure in there so you could have a figure inside I washed the inside with
this mitat light green metallic and you can see that that kind of obscures the
inside but you can still see like the figure inside so that's kind of neat and
then when you want to extract the figure you can just pop the bottom off there
and you can see that once it's painted those details really look good like it
doesn't look like the hodge podge anymore if it looks like one whole piece
and I did some lighter green on the eyes and the chest piece to kind of bring it
out but yeah I think it came out really great and that's an infernal machine a
great way you can take some junk from your bits box and make something cool
out of it so I'll see you next time on the crafts hey crafters I hope you've
enjoyed this episode of the dance craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons
of other videos as you can see I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap terrain for the table if all this
intrigues you make sure you check out all the videos below also join my forum
we have lots of great crafters on there who give advice I have a link above and
below and last but not least remember go forth and craft
you
